story:
Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there was a magical forest filled with all sorts of wondrous creatures. In this forest, there lived a kind and gentle deer named Daisy.

Daisy was unlike any other deer in the forest. She had a beautiful, shimmering coat that sparkled in the sunlight and a gentle, caring heart that touched the souls of all who met her.

One day, as Daisy was wandering through the forest, she came across a small, crying bird who had fallen from its nest. Daisy knew that the bird would not survive long on the forest floor, so she carefully picked it up in her mouth and carried it back to her own home.

Daisy made a soft bed for the bird in a cozy corner of her home and fed it with the freshest leaves and berries she could find. She cared for the bird with all her heart, and over time, the bird grew stronger and healthier.

As the bird grew, it became more and more curious about the world outside of Daisy's home. Daisy could see that the bird was ready to fly, but she was also a little sad to see it go.

One day, as Daisy was sitting in her favorite spot in the forest, she heard a beautiful singing coming from above. She looked up and saw the bird, flying higher and higher, its voice ringing out through the trees.

Daisy watched with joy as the bird soared through the sky, free and happy. And as she watched, she knew that she had done a good thing by caring for the bird and helping it to fly.

From that day on, Daisy knew that she had a special gift for caring for others and helping them to find their own way in the world. And every time she saw a bird flying high above the forest, she would smile and remember the special bond that she and the bird had shared.

As Daisy drifted off to sleep that night, she knew that she was loved and cared for, and that she had the power to make a difference in the world. And she knew that she would always have the strength and courage to follow her heart and do what was right.

The end.

Now, my dear daughter, it's time for you to close your eyes and drift off to sleep, just like Daisy. And I hope that you, too, will always have the strength and courage to follow your heart and do what is right. Good night, sweet princess. I love you.
